Class RLTimer

java.lang.Object
  




public class RLTimer
extends StatsDisplay

A customizable timer that counts down to zero in seconds. Easy to resize and re-skin. Timer variable ActsPS must be set if the program speed changes from the default (the center point of the slider).

Intended for use in shorter mini-games or levels. Use the returnTime() method in another world or object method to trigger events.

Version:
Sept 2014
Author:
Roland Li, modified by Albion Fung

Constructor Detail

RLTimer

public RLTimer(int mxTime)
RLTimer Base constructor; time starts at entered max amount, and can never exceed this amount.

Parameters:
mxTime - Sets the maximum time for the timer

RLTimer

public RLTimer(int mxTime,
               int crTime)
RLTimer Constructor that sets both the max and starting times.

Intended for situations where time can be increased to amounts higher than what the timer started with, such as a game with many time power-ups.

Parameters:
mxTime - Sets the maximum time for the timer
crTime - Sets the starting time for the timer

RLTimer

public RLTimer(int mxTime,
               int crTime,
               int aps)
RLTimer Constructor that sets max and starting times, as well as the required number of acts per second.

Intended for programs that runs at a defined (not default) speed.

Parameters:
mxTime - Sets the maximum time for the timer
crTime - Sets the starting time for the timer
aps - Sets the number of actions needed for one second to pass; varies depending on program speed
Method Detail

act

public void act()
Runs the timer.

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.Actor

decreaseTime

public void decreaseTime(int decTime)
Decreases current time by entered amount, but not to less than 0; time defaults to zero if total is negative.

Parameters:
addTime - Amount to decrease

increaseTime

public void increaseTime(int addTime)
Increases current time by entered amount, but not more than the set maximum; time defaults to max if total exceeds it.

Parameters:
addTime - Amount to add

resetTime

public void resetTime()
Sets current time back to the maximum. Easy and quick way to reset the timer without needing to input an interger.

returnTime

public int returnTime()
Returns the time remaining. Use in another object or the world to trigger events that occur once the timer hits zero or another set time.

setAPS

public void setAPS(int newAPS)
Changes Acts Per Second count; scale according to how the speed is set for the program. Allows for a more accurate time counter- defaulted to 60 for base speed (middle preset).

setTime

public void setTime(int newTime)
Changes time to set amount. Amount defaults to maxTime if entered amount exceeds it, and defaults to 0 if amount is negative.

Parameters:
newTime - Desired time

setTime

public void setTime(int newTime,
                    int newMax)
Sets both the maximum time and the current time.

Useful for situations such as new levels where more time is allotted.

Parameters:
newTime - Desired time
newMax - Desired max time limit
